title: Trump has 'determined' the U.S. is in 'armed conflict' with cartels, administration tells Congress
summary: The U.S. military has recently struck at least three boats from Venezuela allegedly carrying narco-traffickers and drugs that could threaten Americans, Trump said on Truth Social.
story: The Trump administration informed Congress in a confidential notice this week that President Donald Trump has "determined" that the United States is in an “armed conflict” with drug cartels and that members of the organizations can be targeted as unlawful combatants.

“The President determined these cartels are non-state armed groups, designated them as terrorist organizations, and determined that their actions constitute an armed attack against the United States,” the notice said.

"In response, based upon the cumulative effects of these hostile acts against the citizens and interests of United States and friendly foreign nations, the President determined that the United States is in a non-international armed conflict with these designated terrorist organizations,” it added.
The designation essentially puts drug cartels in the same legal category as terrorist groups like Al Qaeda or the Islamic State.
In recent weeks, the U.S. military struck at least three boats from Venezuela allegedly carrying narco-traffickers and drugs that could threaten Americans, Trump said on Truth Social.
The notice to Congress listed examples of actions Trump could take in targeting cartels and cited an attack on Sept. 15 that killed “approximately 3 unlawful combatants.”
The White House has defended the strikes.

“As we have said many times, the President acted in line with the law of armed conflict to protect our country from those trying to bring deadly poison to our shores, and he is delivering on his promise to take on the cartels and eliminate these national security threats from murdering more Americans,” White House spokesperson Anna Kelly said in a statement Thursday.
NBC News reported last month that the administration is considering strikes on drug cartels inside Venezuela.
Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has denied any role in drug trafficking and has repeatedly alleged that the United States is trying to force him from power.

Many critics of the strikes, including congressional Democrats and some Republicans, maintain the administration still does not have the legal authority to target the drug cartels using the U.S. military and that it remains a law enforcement matter relying on interdiction. Secretary of State Marco Rubio, who is also acting national security adviser, has declared interdiction efforts ineffective.

title: FDA quietly approved a generic abortion pill ahead of shutdown
summary: The FDA quietly approved a generic form of mifepristone, one of the two medications used in most U.S. abortions, on Tuesday.
story: The Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday quietly approved a generic form of mifepristone, one of the two medications used in most U.S. abortions.
That makes the drug, from the company Evita Solutions, the second generic version to hit the market. The first, from pharmaceutical company GenBioPro, was approved in 2019.
Mifepristone is typically used in combination with another pill, misoprostol, to induce abortions. Medication abortions account for nearly two-thirds of abortions in the U.S.

The FDA wrote in a letter to Evita Solutions on Tuesday, the day before the government shutdown began, that its mifepristone tablets were “therapeutically equivalent” to the brand-name version, Mifeprex, which has been available in the U.S. since 2000.
On its website, Evita Solutions describes its mission as assisting “the medical community in recognizing the utility and freedom that medical abortion provides patients.”
“We seek to normalize abortion care, and we commit to making care accessible to all,” it adds.
The company did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

The FDA approval comes less than two weeks after Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. told Republican state attorneys general in a letter that the FDA would review mifepristone’s safety.

In the letter, Kennedy and FDA Commissioner Marty Makary wrote that the FDA’s past decisions to roll back certain restrictions on mifepristone access had not been given “adequate consideration” at the time.
Andrew Nixon, a spokesperson for the Health and Human Services Department, said the FDA does not endorse drug products and directs prescribers to follow all labeling.

“The FDA has very limited discretion in deciding whether to approve a generic drug. By law, the Secretary of Health and Human Services must approve an application if it demonstrates that the generic drug is identical to the brand-name drug,” Nixon said in a statement.

“Generic applicants are not required to submit independent evidence proving safety and effectiveness,” he added. “HHS is conducting a study of the reported adverse effects of mifepristone to ensure the FDA’s risk mitigation program for the drug is sufficient to protect women from unstated risks.”
The FDA often issues a press release after new or significant drug approvals, but did not in this case.
The approval provoked a furious response from Marjorie Dannenfelser, the president of the anti-abortion group SBA Pro-Life America.

“Secretary Kennedy and FDA Commissioner Makary assured Congress and the American people they would conduct a thorough review given credible evidence of the harm inflicted by these drugs,” she said. “The prompt completion of the review is made more urgent given this approval to flood the market with a cheap abortion drug.”

Peer-reviewed research has long shown that serious adverse reactions from abortion pills are rare. In combination, mifepristone and misoprostol can be used up to 70 days after the start of the last menstrual period. The former blocks the hormone progesterone, which supports pregnancy, and the latter induces contractions.

Brittany Fonteno, CEO of the National Abortion Federation, the professional association of abortion providers, said in a statement that the approval of a second generic drug for mifepristone “underscores what research has shown for decades: medication abortion is safe, effective, and essential health care, used by millions with proven efficacy.”

Anti-abortion activists have for years called on the FDA to revoke the approval of the first generic drug for mifepristone, as well as two particular rule changes for the drug’s use. (The first, in 2016, said that mifepristone could be used up to 10 weeks’ gestation instead of seven, and the second, in 2021, eliminated a requirement that mifepristone be dispensed in person, allowing it to be prescribed via telehealth and mailed nationwide.)

In their letter last month, Kennedy and Makary cited an April report from a conservative think tank, the Ethics and Public Policy Center, which claimed to find a higher rate of serious complications from mifepristone than reported by the FDA. But that report was not peer-reviewed or published in a medical journal, and reproductive health researchers have said it amounts to junk science.

Over the last several months, many conservatives have cited the report as a reason the FDA should look more closely at mifepristone’s safety. In July, 22 Republican attorneys general sent a letter to Kennedy and Makary to that effect; the letter the two sent last month was a response to that request.

Anti-abortion groups have in the past been skeptical of Kennedy, a former Democrat who ran for president in 2023 as a proponent of abortion rights. He later said he supported restrictions after a certain point in a pregnancy. Kennedy’s stance on abortion was a source of consternation for some conservatives during his Senate confirmation hearing.

title: Robert Morris, Texas megachurch pastor, pleads guilty to sexually abusing a child
summary: PAWHUSKA, Okla.— Robert Morris, the Texas megachurch pastor who built Gateway Church into one of the largest congregations in the country, pleaded guilty Thursday in Osage County District Court to charges that he sexually abused a girl in the 1980s
story: PAWHUSKA, Okla.— Robert Morris, the Texas megachurch pastor who built Gateway Church into one of the largest congregations in the country, pleaded guilty Thursday in Osage County District Court to charges that he sexually abused a girl in the 1980s.

Morris, 64, entered the plea before Judge Cindy Pickerill, admitting to five felony counts of lewd or indecent acts with a child. Under a negotiated plea agreement, he was given a 10-year sentence, but he will serve only six months in the county jail. He must also register as a sex offender and pay $250,000 in restitution.
Morris was handcuffed and taken into custody after Thursday's hearing.

title: 41+ actually good early October Prime Day deals
summary: You don’t have to wait until October 7 to save — here are the top early Prime Day discounts live today.
story: Amazon’s October Prime Day, Prime Big Deal Days, is less than a week away — this year it runs from Oct. 7 to 8, and, like years’ past, it’s exclusive to Prime members. But that doesn’t mean you should wait to shop. The retailer is dropping new early deals daily from some of our favorite brands like Apple, Neutrogena and Shark. And if you check out soon, you’ll get the exact size, style or model you’re looking for, which is especially important if you’re starting to buy gifts for loved ones.

I frequently cover shopping events like Prime Day, Black Friday and Cyber Monday as a writer for NBC Select, so I know how to find deals that are actually worth buying. I combed through thousands of discounts to find the best early October Prime Day deals — each one I recommend below is highly rated and 20% off or more, as well as at its lowest price in at least three months or lowest price ever. I’ll frequently update this list leading up to Prime Big Deal Days.

CeraVe Skin Renewing Vitamin C Eye Cream

Cerave’s fragrance-free eye cream is made with vitamin C to brighten dark under eyes and caffeine to reduce puffiness, plus hyaluronic acid and ceramides to moisturize skin, according to the brand. It has a lightweight, non-sticky, non-greasy feel that quickly absorbs into skin, and is safe for those who wear contacts, according to Cerave. The brand recommends using it twice daily.
Amazon Fire TV Stick HD

Stream your favorite shows, movies, music and more from any TV when you plug this Fire Stick into an HDMI port. It comes with an Alexa Voice Remote, letting you adjust settings via voice commands, and it displays pictures in vibrant HD. You can also use the Fire Stick to control compatible smart home devices like thermostats, cameras and lights.
Ecolution Micro-Pop Microwave Popcorn Popper

Ecolution’s Micro-Pop is one of my favorite kitchen gadgets because it helps me make fresh, warm popcorn in minutes (trust me, it’s way better than the store-bought stuff). You add kernels to the built-in measuring cup on the lid, pour them into the bowl and place it in the microwave for about three minutes. You can also put butter on top of the lid, which has holes in it;  as the butter melts in the microwave, it drips onto the popcorn. The 3-quart, dishwasher-safe popper has a wide opening, so once it cools down, it doubles as a serving bowl.
Eucerin Radiant Tone Dual Serum Dark Spot Corrector

This serum helps reduce the look of dark spots, even out your skin tone and smooth fine lines and wrinkles with consistent use, according to the brand. It has a light texture and is safe for all skin types, according to Eucerin, plus you can use it day or night.
Oral-B iO Deep Clean Rechargeable Electric Powered Toothbrush

Oral-B’s electric toothbrush has all the features dentists told me to look for while shopping: a pressure sensor, a built-in timer, multiple cleaning settings and a brush head change alert. The rechargeable toothbrush comes with two replacement brush heads and a travel case.
Shark Lift-Away Upright Vacuum (ZD201)

This corded upright vacuum, which is suitable for all floor types, has a detachable pod you can tote around your home to clean above doorframes, under furniture,on top of upholstery and on stairs. Its HEPA filter traps dust and other allergens while it suctions up debris, and its LED headlights illuminate dirt so you don’t miss spots. The vacuum comes with crevice and upholstery tools.
Ring Battery Doorbell Plus

See, hear and speak to visitors with this video doorbell. It pairs with Ring’s app, which shows you HD livestream footage (including in color night vision) and sends you alerts when the device detects people, packages or motion. The doorbell is powered by a removable, rechargeable battery, so there’s no electrical work required for setup, and it comes with mounting tools, too.
Amazon Smart Plug

Plug devices like fans, air purifiers and small kitchen appliances into this smart plug to control them via the Amazon Alexa app or voice commands.  The app also lets you set up schedules, timers and routines for your devices.  The plug is compact, so it won’t block your second outlet.
Amazon Echo Pop

This Bluetooth speaker may be small, but it’s loud enough to fill a room with sound whether you’re listening to music, a podcast or an audiobook. It has Amazon Alexa built-in, so you can use voice commands to ask questions, set timers and reminders, control compatible smart home devices and more. I keep my Echo Pop in my bedroom and ask Alexa about the weather while I’m getting dressed every day. The device has volume control buttons, as well as a button to turn the microphone off.
Belif Vitamin E Jelly Overnight Mask

Dry skin season is upon us now that the temperatures are dropping, so adding more hydrating products to your routine might be beneficial. This lightweight, no-rinse mask creates a barrier over your skin to lock in moisture overnight. It’s made with ingredients like hyaluronic acid and niacinamide, which leave your skin feeling smoother and looking more plump after use, according to the brand.
Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition Essentials Bundle

You get a Kindle Paperwhite, fabric cover and wireless charging dock with this bundle, covering all your essentials if you’re getting your first e-reader or upgrading. The Paperwhite has a 7-inch glare-free screen and a 12-week battery life, according to the brand, plus its front light automatically adjusts to whatever environment you’re in. It’s also water-resistant, so you can read at the beach, pool or in the bath. The cover that’s included with this bundle attaches to your e-reader, waking it up or putting it to sleep as you open and close it like a book.
Amazon Blink Mini 2

The Blink Mini 2 is one of my favorite security cameras because it’s so small — it blends into my space instead of being an eyesore. You can use it indoors and outdoors, and it connects to the Blink app, where you can livestream HD footage, hear audio and speak to people and pets. The camera also has a built-in spotlight, and you can use it as a plug-in chime with Blink Video Doorbells (which are also currently on sale). The app sends you motion detection alerts, too.
Keurig K-Express Single Serve Coffee Maker

Keurig makes some of our favorite single-serve coffee makers, and this one is a particularly good option if you have limited countertop space due to its compact size. Still, it has all the important features, like a strong brew mode, three cup sizes and a removable reservoir that holds enough water to make multiple beverages. You can also remove the machine’s drip tray to fit travel mugs underneath the spout. The K-Express is compatible with all types of K-Cups, many of which are also currently on sale.
Blueair 311i Max Air Purifier

Air purifiers like this one can remove tiny airborne particles from your home, like allergens, dust, smoke, bacteria and pet hair. The Blueair 311i connects to WiFi and pairs with the brand’s app, letting you adjust its mode (auto or night), fan speed, brightness and child lock setting, as well as track filter usage, air quality and more. The appliance is best for medium rooms and it responds to voice commands, too.
Shark Beauty SpeedStyle Pro Flex Hair Dryer System

Take your hair from wet to dry to styled with this hot tool, which regulates its temperature to prevent heat damage, according to the brand. It also has a scalp shield mode that lowers the air temperature when you’re drying your roots. The SpeedStyle is lightweight and it has a folding handle, making it compact and travel-friendly. It comes with multiple attachments, including a concentrator, diffuser and frizz fighting tool — when you add an attachment, the tool automatically adjusts its heat and airflow level accordingly (you can manually change settings, too).

title: Lori Loughlin and Mossimo Giannulli Split After Nearly 28 Years of Marriage
summary: Lori Loughlin and Mossimo Giannulli have separated after nearly 28 years of marriage, her rep confirmed to TODAY.com.
story: Lori Loughlin and Mossimo Giannulli have separated after nearly 28 years of marriage.

Loughlin’s representative confirmed to TODAY.com on Thursday, Oct. 2, that the actor and fashion designer, who share daughters Isabella Rose Giannulli, 27, and Olivia Jade Giannulli, 26, are not currently living together.
“I can confirm that Lori and Mossimo are living apart and that no legal proceedings are underway,” Loughlin’s rep said.
According to People, Loughlin and Giannulli placed their Hidden Hills, California, home on the market in February.

Loughlin, 61, and Giannulli, 62, eloped on Thanksgiving Day in 1997 after dating for two years, according to The Hollywood Reporter. Giannulli founded the fashion company Mossimo, which was sold in Target stores from 2000 to 2017. He sold the brand to Iconix Brand Group in 2006, the Los Angeles Times reported.

The “Full House” star and Giannulli have faced some challenges during their marriage, most notably a college admissions bribery scandal. In 2019, the two admitted to paying $500,000 to falsely claim their daughters were rowing recruits to help them get accepted to the University of Southern California.

Loughlin pleaded guilty to a federal charge of conspiracy to commit wire fraud and mail fraud. She was sentenced to a two-month prison term and received a $150,000 fine, as well as 100 hours of community service.
The fashion designer pleaded guilty to an additional charge of conspiracy to commit honest services wire and mail fraud, which led to him serving a five-month sentence.
In 2024, Loughlin discussed her personal life and family in her first interview since the scandal with First for Women.

“My family wasn’t one to hold grudges,” she said at the time. “I didn’t grow up in a household where if you made a mistake, you weren’t forgiven. No one is perfect, we all make mistakes. So I was always told to let stuff go. And I think for your own health, you have to let things go because you can’t hang on to negativity. Life’s too short.”
Before her marriage to Giannulli, Loughlin was previously married to entertainment executive Michael Burns from 1989 to 1996.

title: Prince William Shares the 1 'Very Strict' Rule He and Kate Middleton Have for Their 3 Kids
summary: While appearing on "The Reluctant Traveler," Prince William told Eugene Levy how he and Kate Middleton are "very strict" about their three kids not having phones.
story: Prince William and Catherine, Princess of Wales, are doing their best to make sure their children live a relatively normal life amid their royal duties.

During the latest episode of “The Reluctant Traveler With Eugene Levy," premiering on Apple TV+ Oct. 3, the Prince of Wales shared the “very strict” rule he and the former Kate Middleton have for their three children: Prince George, 12, Princess Charlotte, 10, and Prince Louis, 7.
While exploring the Windsor Castle grounds, Eugene Levy asked what the 43-year-old royal does when he's home and if that includes sit-down dinners with his three kids.
“Absolutely, yes, definitely,” William said about having dinner as a family. He then elaborated on what goes on at the table.
"So, sit and chat is really important,” the prince said. “None of our children have any phones, which we’re very strict about.”
Surprised by his no-phone rule, Levy asked what interests his kids have if they don’t spend time on a mobile device.

“Louis loves the trampoline, so he’s obsessed by trampolining and actually, Charlotte does a lot as well. As far as I can tell, they just end up jumping up and down the trampoline, beating each other up most of the time,” he shared.
“Apparently, there is an art to it," he jokingly added.
He also shared that his daughter’s favorite activities include netball and ballet.

“So keeping them busy with sports and just being outdoors is really important. They’re trying to learn musical instruments. I’m not sure how successful we’re being with that,” he continued, before sharing what his eldest son is into these days.
“George loves his football, his hockey,” he shared.
Overall, the prince said that the most important thing in his life is his family and making sure they feel “warmth, that feeling of safety, security, love. That all has to be there.”

title: Pamela Anderson Debuts New Fiery Red Hair at Paris Fashion Week
summary: Pamela Anderson ditched her signature blond tresses for a strawberry blond shag cut.
story: Pamela Anderson is entering her red era.
The 58-year-old actor ditched her famous blond tresses for a cute strawberry blond shag cut when she showed up to a Condé Nast Paris Fashion Week party earlier this week.
Director and photographer Marco Bahler shared pics on Instagram of Anderson wearing a sleeveless white dress. Her coppery hair was cut in a choppy layered cut with bangs.
“Pamela looking fabulous with her new hair,” Bahler captioned his photos.
Days later, when the “Naked Gun” star, whose beauty transformations have made headlines for years, stepped out to a Tom Ford fashion show on Oct. 1, she wore her red hair slicked back.
The following day, she transformed her look again when she showed up with bouncy waves in her hair to a Mugler womenswear fashion show.
Anderson shot to stardom in the 1990s as a platinum blond bombshell when she portrayed lifeguard C.J. Parker on the beachside drama "Baywatch."
Over the years, she's turned heads with her fashion choices, including the bold decision to go without makeup altogether, a look she first debuted at Paris Fashion Week in 2023.

“I know I wasn’t making strides toward world peace, but I was making a statement,” Anderson told Vogue of her chose to forgo makeup at the time. “I just thought, I’m doing this for all the girls out there. I’ve had stepdaughters in past relationships, and my sons have girlfriends, and this was for them.
"In this day and age, do we even know what a face looks like anymore? This is it," she added.

Anderson has since committed to the fresh-faced look on her own time, though she’s worn makeup onscreen in the two critically acclaimed movies she’s since starred in, 2024’s “The Last Showgirl” and 2025’s “The Naked Gun.”
As for her hair, Anderson appears to be having a ball while trying out different lengths and colors.

“Your hair is another way to express yourself, and I’ve never been shy,” she told Harper’s Bazaar in August. “I guess I’m genetically blessed, but I’ve always had very thick, healthy hair. I do like to cut it and to style it differently. It’s freeing. I am a big lover of change; that’s what keeps us young and excited.”

title: When Does Taylor Swift's New Album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' Come Out?
summary: When does Taylor Swift's Life of a Showgirl come out? Here's when to listen to the album and how to listen.
story: When Taylor Swift appeared on the "New Heights" podcast over the summer to announce that she was releasing a new album, she basically broke the internet.
From there, it didn't take long for "The Life of a Showgirl" to become the most pre-saved album in Spotify history.
Now, the wait is almost over and Swifties are counting down the hours. Here's everything we know about the release of "The Life of a Showgirl"
When Will 'The Life of a Showgirl' Be Released?
"The Life of a Showgirl" will officially be available on Friday, Oct. 3, 2025 at midnight.
"The Life of a Showgirl" will feature 12 songs, including a title track with Sabrina Carpenter. Here's the tracklist:
The Fate of Ophelia
Elizabeth Taylor
Opalite
Father Figure
Eldest Daughter
Ruin The Friendship
Actually Romantic
Wi$h Li$t
Wood
CANCELLED!
Honey
The Life of a Showgirl (feat. Sabrina Carpenter)
How to See the New Music Video, 'The Fate of Ophelia'
Swifties had the chance to dance and sing their hearts out in movie theaters when she released “Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour” concert film in 2023.
In the weeks leading up to the premiere of "The Life of a Showgirl," Swift announced that she was teaming up with movie theaters once again for a "dazzling soirée."

Officially titled “The Official Release Party of a Showgirl,” the event will feature the premiere of the music video for "The Fate of Ophelia" and behind-the-scenes footage of the making of the video. Showings will take place Oct. 3 through 5.
The music video will be published on YouTube at 7 p.m. ET on Sunday, Oct. 5, per the official schedule.
Sirius XM Launched a Temporary Taylor Swift Channel

To celebrate the release of "The Life of a Showgirl," Sirius XM recently debuted a Taylor Swift channel, Channel 13, that features every era of the singer's songs, including tracks from the vault and live cuts.
The temporary channel will play the new album starting at midnight on Oct. 3.
Travis Kelce Already Has a Favorite Song from the New Album
During Swift's appearance on her fiancé Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast in August, Kelce applauded "The Life of a Showgirl."
"I’ve been fortunate enough to hear every single song on here. So I know they’re all 12 bangers,” he said.
In a later episode, Kelce revealed that he’s loving one song from the album in particular.
“I think ‘Opalite’ might be my favorite, though, at least right now. Every time it comes on, I always catch myself,” he said.
Kelce went on to say he can't stop "dancing all throughout the house" whenever the record is on.

"I keep listening to this album. And I know she mentioned that it’s going to be a lot more pop beats and everything, but it’s just, it’s still so poetic, and how she (executes) her melodies and her references and stuff,” he said.

title: LeAnn Rimes Shows Off Nasty Eye Injury — Caused by a Water Bottle
summary: LeAnn Rimes took to Instagram to show how she hit herself in the face with a water bottle, causing her to develop a black eye.
story: LeAnn Rimes is in good spirits as she laughs off her latest injury.
The “I Need You” singer shared how she ended up with a black eye after a hard days work, telling her followers about the incident on her Instagram story on Oct. 1.

“Y’all, I came off set and gave myself a black eye,” she said while sitting in a car and showing off the bruising near her brow. “I hit myself — oh my God, this is a f------ huge bump — I hit myself in the eye with this.”
Rimes then showed off the culprit; her reusable water bottle.
“Just when I start to get this little bruise underneath,” she continued, pointing to her cheek.
"Good times, what the hell," she added.
In a second Instagram story video, she showed a closer look at her black eye without makeup.
“OK guys, this is what it looks like now. What in the world,” she said, adding, “It’s really sad that I’ve done this to myself.”
The Grammy winner is no stranger to an “oops” moment. In June, the “Can’t Fight the Moonlight” singer shared an Instagram video about her teeth falling out mid-concert.

“So, last night, I was onstage, and in the middle of ‘One Way Ticket,’ I feel something pop in my mouth,” she said. “And if you’ve been around, you know I’ve had a lot of dental surgeries, and I have a bridge in the front, and it fell out in the middle of my song last night.”
She said she first “panicked” but then was able to pull herself together and “put it back in — like, popped it back in — and then just went on singing.”
At the time, she added that she hoped it would be “a first and hopefully a last” in her career.

title: 'General Hospital' Isn't Airing Due to MLB Playoffs. Stars Explain When It Will Be Back
summary: "General Hospital" has been preempted three days this week due to the Major League Baseball playoffs on ABC. Here's when the daytime soap will return.
story: "General Hospital" will soon be making its return to daytime TV.

The show, which normally airs new episodes on weekdays on ABC, was preempted this week on Tuesday, Sept. 30, Wednesday, Oct. 1, and Thursday, Oct. 2, due to the network's coverage of the Major League Baseball playoffs.
However, “General Hospital” stars Maurice Benard and Steve Burton just assured fans the show will be returning to ABC this Friday, Oct. 3, in an Instagram video the show posted.
They said, "Hey, guys, I know you've been missing 'General Hospital' this week, but we have some good news. We're back tomorrow. Tune in."
In the comments, fans raved about the show's return.
"Thank Christ! It feels like 3 YEARS have passed," one person said with emoji including the crying-laughing emoji.
Another wrote, "FINALLY!!!! I can’t wait to watch on Hulu tomorrow night. TGIF!"
A third added, "Pure awesomeness!!! Finally getting our fix of our favorite show."
If you want to learn more about why "General Hospital" was preempted this week, then scroll below.
Why Isn’t 'General Hospital' Airing Today?
"General Hospital" was preempted by MLB games on Tuesday, Sept. 30, Wednesday, Oct. 1, and Thursday, Oct. 2.
On Instagram earlier this week, the series announced that it would not be showing any new "General Hospital" episodes those days due to the MLB Wild Card round.

"Due to planned programming preemptions today, tomorrow and potentially on Thursday —  #GeneralHospital will return with new episodes later this week. We will alert you once we know more (depending on how the MLB Wild Card Series plays out). Thank you so much for your patience. It will be worth the wait, we promise," it said on Sept. 30 with a wink-face emoji.

On Oct. 2, the Detroit Tigers will face off against the Cleveland Guardians at 3:08 p.m. ET on ABC. Then, the San Diego Padres will go up against the Chicago Cubs at 5:08 p.m. ET on ESPN. The day will conclude with a Game 3 matchup between the Boston Red Sox and the New York Yankees at 8:08 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: What the 'Wheel of Fortune' Winner Plans to Do with Her Historic $1M Jackpot
summary: Christina Derevjanik opens up to TODAY.com about winning the biggest Wheel of Fortune prize ever.
story: Christina Derevjanik, a marketing manager from Stamford, Connecticut, made history on the Sept. 30 episode of "Wheel of Fortune" when she racked up $1,035,155 in prizes. In doing so, she became the biggest winner the game show has ever seen.
"It was just such a surreal experience," she tells TODAY.com about the moment.

"I was so excited to just be able to be a contestant on the show — to then become the biggest winner of all time on 'Wheel of Fortune' was just the cherry on top. I couldn't have dreamt of anything better than that."

Derevjanik's love for "Wheel of Fortune" started from a young age. She says she grew up watching the program and felt like she could be a "strong contestant" on the show because she always “loved wordplay” and “problem-solving" and was very skilled with "numbers, writing and communication."

In fact, when her father learned she was chosen to be on the show after a year-long audition process, he dusted off the handheld "Wheel of Fortune" game she used to play with in the '90s to help her prepare for the program.
"He somehow managed to save that for 25, 30 years," she laughs.
It felt like destiny.
When it came for her to take her turn "Wheel of Fortune," Derevjanik got off to a rocky start, failing to win either of the two toss-ups to open the show.

She caught a break when she landed on the $1 million wedge during a spin on the first puzzle. Derevjanik then landed on another wedge for a trip to Montana and before she knew it, she was winning big. She won a second trip to Tokyo and got $35,155 in cash and prizes before she made it to the bonus round where the $1 million wedge was in play.

After selecting the “Living Things” category, Derevjanik easily solved the puzzle, which was "Pack of Coyotes." The only four letters she guessed were M, C, F and A after the show had already put T, E, S on the board.
When asked why she guessed "C," which appeared to be a random guess, she joked that that letter held special meaning to her.
"My name starts with C, so I may be favorable to it, but I definitely had that letter in my mind," she says.

"The other letters, I just pulled out as I saw the puzzle. But once those C's came in and I saw where they were in the puzzle, it just came to me before the timer even started, I knew exactly what it was."
After she guessed correctly, Seacrest then opened the prize envelope and revealed she had won the highly-coveted $1 million prize, which only three people have won on the show previously.
Her reaction? Ecstasy!
"It was pure shock, excitement, and joy," she says of what she was feeling in the moment. "It was an out-of-body experience."
"It just goes to show you that you should take chances. You never know what's going to come of it. It could be life-changing," she adds.

On the show, Derevjanik joked that she would quit her job if she won the $1 million prize. Though her wish came true, she says she is still employed and is enjoying having more "financial freedom" in her life.

"I am definitely planning to invest in a home in the next couple of years, and I have a couple of group trips coming up to Tokyo and Montana, so I'm really excited to just be able to live a little bit more freely and enjoy what life has to offer in the next five years. Then we'll see from then on," she says.
Her advice for anyone who feels scared taking a risk in their life?
"Just do it!" she says.
"I really believe that timing is everything. So I think that when I was able to actually be a contestant, it was the right time for me, and I believe in that," she says.
"My advice to anyone who is thinking about taking that risk is to take it if you feel ready. Just do it. And you never know what's going to happen. It could be the best decision of your life."

title: See the Cast of 'Monster: The Ed Gein Story' Compared to the Real People
summary: Charlie Hunnam is Ryan Murphy's latest monster
story: Charlie Hunnam is Ryan Murphy's latest monster.
The "Sons of Anarchy" star is taking on the role of Ed Gein for the next season of the hit Netflix series, "Monster: The Ed Gein Story."

While Gein might not be a household name, the discovery of his house of horrors in Plainfield, Wisconsin, in 1957 went on to inspire generations of Hollywood filmmakers, from Alfred Hitchcock's "Psycho" in 1960 to Jonathan Demme's "The Silence of the Lambs" in 1991.
Gein was found guilty of murder over a decade after Bernice Worden, a local hardware shop owner, was found dead in his home, according to the Green Bay Press-Gazette.

In addition to Worden's mutilated body, other appalling items were found in his home during the investigation, like soup bowls made from skulls and several severed human body parts, according to the Press-Gazette.

Gein admitted to killing two people in an interview with investigators after Worden was found dead, according to a transcript of the interview included in the book "The Ed Gein File" compiled by John Borowski.

"Monster: The Ed Gein Story" premieres on Oct. 3, and follows Murphy's other seasons on Jeffrey Dahmer and the Menendez brothers. Keep reading to see the cast of this season of "Monster" alongside their real-life counterparts.
Charlie Hunnam as Ed Gein

Charlie Hunnam, known for his roles in "Sons of Anarchy" and "Pacific Rim," will take on the role of Ed Gein, the notorious killer who later inspired films like "Psycho," "Silence of the Lambs" and "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre."
Laurie Metcalf as Augusta Gein

Laurie Metcalf is starring as Augusta Gein, the mother of Ed Gein. Augusta Gein was highly influential in Ed Gein's life, and the state of Wisconsin found in a report he was “inordinately emotionally attached to his mother.”
Suzanna Son as Adeline Watkins

Suzanna Son is portraying Adeline Watkins, a woman who told the Minneapolis Tribune she had a decades-long relationship with Ed Gein in the days following his arrest for the murder of Bernice Worden. Watkins later said the Tribune story contained untrue statements and “was blown up out of proportion to its importance,” according to the Stevens Point Journal.
Tyler Jacob Moore as Sheriff Arthur 'Art' Schley
Tyler Jacob Moore plays Sheriff Arthur “Art” Schley, one of the main investigators in the Ed Gein case who arrested the murderer.
Charlie Hall as Deputy Frank Worden

Eagle-eyed “Monster” fans might recognize Charlie Hall from Season 2 of the show, in which he played Erik Menendez’s friend Craig Cignarelli. In Season 3, he’s set to play Deputy Frank Worden, one of the investigators in the Ed Gein case and the son of one of his victims, Bernice Worden.
Lesley Manville as Bernice Worden

Lesley Manville portrays Bernice Warden, one of Ed Gein’s victims. A judge found Ed Gein guilty of her murder in 1968, but the same judge later found him to be legally insane and ordered him to be committed to a state hospital, according to the Green Bay Press-Gazette.
Addison Rae as Evelyn Hartley

TikToker turned pop star Addison Rae is taking on the role of Evelyn Hartley, a woman who went missing on Oct. 24, 1953. Ed Gein was suspected of her disappearance, as he was visiting a relative a few blocks away from the home where Hartley was last seen, though he was cleared of any involvement in 1957.
Robin Weigert as Enid Watkins
Robin Weigert is set to play Enid Watkins, the mother of Adeline Watkins.
Vicky Krieps as Ilse Koch

Vicky Krieps is portraying Ilse Koch, the wife of the Nazi commandant of the Buchenwald concentration camp. Koch was tried for crimes against humanity at Nuremberg and sentenced to life in prison, though an American military governor of the occupied zone later shortened her sentence to four years. It is believed Ed Gein could have been inspired by Koch when he made a lampshade from human skin, an item found in his house.
Tom Hollander as Alfred Hitchcock
Tom Hollander, who has starred in movies like “Pride & Prejudice” and TV shows like “The White Lotus,” is taking on the role of iconic filmmaker Alfred Hitchcock.
Olivia Williams as Alma Reville

Alma Reville was Alfred Hitchcock's wife from 1926 until his death in 1980. She significantly influenced many of his films, though she often wasn't credited. Olivia Williams is set to star as the screenwriter.
Joey Pollari as Anthony Perkins
Joey Pollari is portraying Anthony Perkins, the star of Hitchcock's 1960 film, "Psycho." In the film, Perkins played Norman Bates, a murderous motel owner with an obsession with his mother.
Mimi Kennedy as Dr. Mildred Newman

Mimi Kennedy is set to portray Dr. Mildred Newman, a psychologist and author who rose to fame in the 1970s for her self-help books. One of her clients was reportedly Anthony Perkins, who wrote an endorsement for her book, “How to Be Your Best Friend,” according to The New York Times.
Will Brill as Tobe Hooper
Tobe Hooper was the filmmaker behind legendary horror movies like "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre," which was partially inspired by Ed Gein. Will Brill is set to portray Hooper.

title: Mariah Carey Explains Why She Doesn’t Dance During Her Shows
summary: Mariah Carey is a five-time Grammy Award winning singer, and some might say the Queen of Christmas, but dancing is one thing she's not interested in
story: Mariah Carey is a five-time Grammy Award winning singer, and some might say the Queen of Christmas, but dancing is one thing she's not interested in.
Carey joined Andy Cohen on "Watch What Happens Live" on Oct. 1, and Cohen said he felt like "people are always commenting about (Carey's) lack of dancing."
"I think what they miss is that you're singing your ass off," he said. "So when you're singing your ass off, you can't be dancing like crazy."

Carey responded to Cohen, offering some insight on why dancing never became a big part of her performance. "From when I first started, I was like, 'Oh, I don't know how I'm gonna do this.' Because, really, I have no idea what this dancing thing is."
"I don't know what it is, and I still don't," she continued, "But there's moments, like, little moments in the 'Honey' video, "Heartbreaker," little stuff."
The singer then noted that dancing was “just something I was never taught and I was kind of traumatized about as a kid.”
Carey released "Honey" in 1997, and "Heartbreaker" in 1999, and opened up about her life, including some of the traumas, in her 2020 memoir, "The Meaning of Mariah Carey."
Cohen said he thought her memoir would make a great movie, and asked if she had anything to report film-wise.

"I'm reporting back that we need Lee Daniels to call us, because we're in the works with him, and we're going to do a scripted series based on the book," she said, referring to the famed director behind films like "Precious" and "Shadowboxer."
"Also I'm working on a documentary about my life. That's a different thing, but it's still got a lot to do with the book," she added.

title: Robert Irwin's 'DWTS' Partner Says She Had 'Moments of Regret' Over His Shirtless Appearance
summary: "Dancing with the Stars" pro Witney Carson says she had "moments of regret" asking her partner, Robert Irwin, to take his shirt off during "TikTok Night" on the program.
story: "Dancing with the Stars" pro Witney Carson says she had "moments of regret" asking her partner, Robert Irwin, to take his shirt off during "TikTok Night" on the program this week.
In the middle of their salsa, Irwin, a wildlife conservationist, ripped off his shirt as he and Carson danced along to Tommy Richman’s hit song “Million Dollar Baby.”
Though their performance earned them a good score of 22 out of 30, Carson wondered whether she should have asked Irwin to show off his abs on the program.
“I had so many moments of regret. I was like, ‘Did I make the right choice taking his shirt off?’” she told "Entertainment Tonight" with a smile after their performance.
Irwin said he feels flattered by the attention he's received.
"It is flattering," he said. "I'm actually getting very red."
Irwin then talked about the jaw-dropping moment and said he loved taking his shirt off on the program.

"That's what I wanted. Onstage, I was like, you know what, I want to show this new side. I want to own this," he said while pretending he was ripping his shirt off again. "I want to give it that bit of oomph, and it was so much fun doing that.
"I've never gotten to do that. I've never gotten to just be like, 'You know what? I'm going to be cool. I'm just going to come and rock this,' and it was fun," he added.
As for how his mom, Terri Irwin, and sister, Bindi Irwin, who previously won Season 21 of "Dancing with the Stars," reacted to the moment, he said they were surprised by it.
"My mum and sister were in the audience and they didn't know I was doing that. I said the shirt may come off, but they weren't expecting the hips," he said with a smile.

On "TikTok Night," Fifth Harmony band member Lauren Jauregui was eliminated from the competition. She joins NBA All-Star Baron Davis and actor Corey Feldman as the celebs who've received the ax so far this season.

title: See Paris Jackson and Janet Jackson's Sweet Reunion at Paris Fashion Week
summary: Paris Jackson, the only daughter of Michael Jackson, and Janet Jackson reunited while attending Tom Ford's fashion show at Paris Fashion Week in October 2025.
story: Michael Jackson's daughter, Paris Jackson, 27, and Janet Jackson, 59, had quite the time at Paris Fashion Week.
On Oct. 1, the duo reunited at the Tom Ford fashion show in Paris, and Paris Jackson, the only daughter of the late legend Michael Jackson, shared pics of their encounter on her Instagram stories.
In one snap, Paris Jackson and her aunt are seen walking side b side, and in another snap, they're giving each other a big hug, with Janet Jackson displaying a huge smile on her face.
For the event, Paris Jackson donned a black dress with a thigh-high split and Janet Jackson wore a black top with a matching skirt.
The aunt-niece duo aren't seen in public together too often. In 2022, they took a picture together during Paris Fashion Week, which Janet Jackson shared on her Instagram.

In the photo, the “Rhythm Nation” singer and Paris Jackson sat on a couch together. Janet Jackson donned a white shirt, gray tie and jacket, black pants and shoes, while her niece wore a nude-colored dress and a pair of thigh-high boots.
Janet Jackson captioned the snap, "So good catching up w/ my beautiful niece @parisjackson 💖💖💖."
The pair were also photographed together at the 2009 memorial service for Michael Jackson. At the time, Paris Jackson was just 11 years old.
Throughout the years, people have speculated that Janet Jackson and Paris Jackson were at odds. However, the "Let Down" singer put those rumors to rest when she took to X in 2018.
She wrote, "Janet and i haven’t argued in over 6 years, stop with these stupid rumors. i have nothing but love for my family and they all know it. f--k off."

title: What Patrick and Kacie Said About Their Shocking 'Love Is Blind' Breakup
summary: Why did Kacie break up with Patrick on Love Is Blind? What she said about the confusing scene and what Patrick said about the breakup and what came nex.t
story: What happens when love isn't really blind? The latest season of “Love Is Blind” features an intense scene that shows that scenario.

In the first six episodes of Season 9, viewers get to know Kacie McIntosh and Patrick Suzuki, two singles based in Denver, Colorado. Their relationship eventually progressed to the engagement phase and they met in person.

Before they went on a romantic getaway to Mexico with the other engaged couples, Kacie decided she couldn't continue with the dating experiment. The reason she gave producers was different than the reason she gave Patrick, however.
What happened between the couple and what have they said about their awkward breakup? We’re sharing everything you need to know.
What happened between Patrick and Kacie in the pods?
Many “Love Is Blind” participants opt to keep their ethnicity out of the conversation to stay true to the dating experiment.

Patrick, a 31-year-old construction manager, seemed keen on following this formula, since he said that he was often the only Asian person in his friend group growing up and said was judged for his looks.

When Kacie, a 34-year-old hair and makeup artist, pressed Patrick on the topic, he eventually opened up. Kacie reassured him that her siblings all date people of other ethnicities and she was open to the idea.

In an interview with the Los Angeles Times, Patrick explained his decision to keep his ethnicity private at first and said he initially thought he wouldn’t address it until he met his fiancé in person.

“I’m starting to catch feelings. These girls are starting to catch feelings. I was like, if you can make it out the pods, and you can make it through all those things, and you get married, this is going to be a pretty strong bond. This might be something you can share forever. At that point, I was like, I have to give them everything and explain to them my background, ethnicity, everything, just to be fully vulnerable,” he said.
What happened after Patrick and Kacie met in person?
Before meeting Kacie in person, Patrick reflected on their connection in a confessional interview and said he felt “secure” with her.
“It’s huge to just be loved for who I am versus my ethnicity or how I look,” he said.
Meanwhile, Kacie offered the following reflection in her own interview.

“I do know he’s Asian. I’ve never dated somebody that looks like him. I’ve always just been so (focused on looks). There’s always this scary part of I know how I am and I just don’t know if I’m going to like, I don’t know. I don’t know how I’m going to be. But I’m so pumped to touch him,” she said.
When they met, the interaction semed to go well. In a confessional interview, Patrick called his fiancé “absolutely gorgeous” and aid his “mind was blown.”
Kacie called him “great” and said, “I finally have somebody that looked at me the way he looked at me.”
Why did Patrick and Kacie break up?

Ah, that's the question that's unclear. Why did Kacie decide to leave the experiment early? To producers, Kacie seemed to say it was a problem of attraction. When speaking to Patrick, she implied the show was overwhelming.
Let's rewind. After meeting Patrick in person, Kacie spoke with producers and said, “He deserves somebody better than me.”
“He’s not a bad looking guy in any sense. But he deserves somebody that is so obsessed with him,” she continued.
“That’s not you?” the producer asked.
“No. I understand how that is about to look,” she said.
When Kacie met with Patrick to discuss her feelings, he wanted to know what it meant for their future.
“Are you trying to break up with me or are you trying to go home cause you don’t want to go to Baja?” he asked.
“No, I don’t want to go to Baja,” she said.
Patrick was OK with skipping the trip but wanted to know if Kacie was trying to break up with him.
“Yeah. No. It’s not that I’m not in love with you. I just can’t do the TV show anymore,” she said.
Patrick asked if he would see Kacie back in Denver. She didn’t give him a straight answer. Instead, she kept kissing him and apologizing repeatedly.
“They asked me if it’s anything to do with what you looked like and it’s like no,” she said.
Patrick continuously reassured Kacie and said they could slow their relationship down.
“No, it’s not that I don’t love you. I don’t want to slow down that way,” she said, adding that she “just can’t do it” when he said they can go home.
Kacie told Patrick she wasn't not sure how he’ll get her phone number, but said he has her last name and can find her on Instagram.
“I wanted this to be different,” she said as she kissed him.
Outside of the hotel, Patrick told producers he stills feels “good” about his relationship with Kacie and said he’s OK with taking things “slow” moving forward.
“I think she’s pretty genuine. I don’t think she’s gaslighting. You can tell we’re attracted to each other. It has nothing to do with physical attraction,” he added.
The scene shifted to conversation between Kacie and the producers.

“I just unfortunately don’t think my attraction to him is going to grow that much and it sucks. I just know it won’t. And I think it would be so unfair to him to have us go to Mexico and then me have to tell him there that I just don’t think I could get there with him, like period,” she said.
What have Kacie and Patrick said about their breakup?
After the first six episodes of "Love Is Blind" Season premiered, Kacie and Patrick spoke with Netflix's publication Tudum and reflected on their awkward breakup. Here's what the both had to say.
Kacie told Tudum that Patrick felt "like a stranger" to her when they met.
“It was hard. I remember being very emotional about it, and I felt bad,” she said.
Kacie told Tudum the conversation wasn’t intended to be a breakup. The reality star said she did want to date Patrick “slowly at our pace at home in Denver” off camera.
“I really wanted to talk to him more, pursue going on dates, and get to know each other on a more physical level to see if this was really real,” she said.
Kacie called Patrick a “handsome guy” and insisted that her reaction was “more about him being a stranger in my arms than it was what he looks like.”
When Kacie told Patrick he wanted to give their relationship a try at home, he took her for her word.
“I’m not even thinking that she’s breaking up with me, really. I didn’t really know that’s what was happening,” he said.
Patrick was concerned about the conversation, though.

“Immediately, my guard is going up. I’m still trying to process the emotions of the reveal. I felt like it went good, and I’m going to sleep that night thinking we’re going to Mexico, and for her to say she wanted to go back home, that definitely raised an initial red flag. I was trying to hide a lot of the emotions,” he said.
While speaking with the Los Angeles Times, Patrick said he was "so confused" about the way Kacie handled the conversation.

“I’m just trying to figure out what she’s trying to tell me the whole time. I just didn’t understand what she was trying to tell me. But looking back on it, it’s like, ‘Oh, she was just trying to tell me she didn’t want to do it anymore.’ In the heat of the moment, your emotions are running high; I still fully trusted her,” he said.
Despite the way it turned out, Patrick still said the experience was "transformative."

"I didn’t know what I was getting into, exactly, when I got there. I’m just really glad that I did it and glad that things happened the way they did because it made me a lot stronger man, I think, and made me break free from a lot of things that I was dealing with and learn a lot about myself. Overall, 10 out of 10, A-plus experience," he said.

title: See the Moment One of Hoda Kotb's Favorite ‘America's Got Talent’ Singers Surprised Her on TODAY
summary: "America's Got Talent" singer Chuck Adams surprised Hoda Kotb on the TODAY show, after she reshared a video of his performance on her Instagram page.
story: A singer whose moving performance on “America’s Got Talent” captivated Hoda Kotb got to meet the former TODAY co-anchor.
Chuck Adams went viral for his passionate cover of the Goo Goo Dolls’ classic “Iris” when, at the age of 40, he appeared on “AGT” in June, with a performance that Hoda herself shared.
While appearing on TODAY Oct. 2 to discuss her latest book, “Jump and Find Joy: Embracing Change in Every Season of Life,” Hoda was surprised by Adams.
Adams, who tried to make it in the hip-hop industry over the course of a decade, said he was so grateful that Hoda appreciated his audition.

“I love that Hoda was moved by the performance and that it can lead to something like this,” he said in a taped spot that aired before he surprised her. “I just speak from a place of truth, and I hope I sing from that same place. So, when someone who has lived it and experienced it approves, that means the most to me.”
Adams eventually pivoted away from R&B to country music, moving to Nashville in 2014. He auditioned for “AGT” after much encouragement from his mother.
“Something about this season when things are different. I felt different about life, about trying new things,” he said. “I’ve just been in this phase of just saying yes.”
“Taking the jump for me is always the way to go,” he added. “I don’t really regret things or look back.”
Adams’ time on “AGT” ended during the quarterfinals, but he said he does have some prospects for what’s next.
After the segment aired, Savannah Guthrie said to Hoda: “Now, how long did you work here at the TODAY show?”
“Do you think that we have Chuck here hiding behind a wall?” she joked.
“I would hope so!” Hoda replied.
Adams walked out and hugged an emotional Hoda.
“This is so cool,” he said.
“I am so proud of you and so happy for you,” Hoda said about Adams’ determination to continue his music career after setbacks.
Adams told Hoda he appreciated her resharing his performance and sharing her own story of making jumps in life.
“It makes me feel seen and comforted a little bit,” he said. “Just keep going.”
Then Adams broke out into an a cappella rendition of “Iris.”
“That was beautiful,” Hoda said.

title: A Taylor Swift Fan's Guide to 'Hamlet' and the Story of Ophelia
summary: Taylor Swift seemingly references Ophelia from Shakespeare's tragic play "Hamlet" in her new album's opening track, "The Fate of Ophelia."
story: In her follow-up to the "The Tortured Poets Department," Taylor Swift is continuing to delight her bookish fans with literary references on her 12th studio album, “The Life of a Showgirl."

The 35-year-old Grammy winner famously crammed tons of literary references into the lyrics and song titles of her previous studio album. Her earlier songs, too, feature allusions to "The Great Gatsby," "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland," the Robert Frost poem “The Road Not Taken" and more.

Even before the album's official release on Oct. 3, fans have surmised that in "The Life of a Showgirl," Swift circles back to one of her earlier inspirations, English playwright and poet William Shakespeare, whose characters Romeo and Juliet appear in her 2008 hit “Love Story."
This time around, Swift name-drops Ophelia, seemingly referencing a character from another tragic play, "Hamlet."
Ophelia's name pops up in title of the album's first track, "The Fate of Ophelia." But who is she? And what does her name signify?
What To Know About ‘Hamlet’
"Hamlet" is a tragic play that Shakespeare wrote sometime between 1599 and 1601.

The play, which is set in Denmark, tells the story of the troubled young prince Hamlet, who vows to exact revenge on his uncle Claudius after Claudius murders Hamlet's father, the king of Denmark, to steal the throne and marry Hamlet’s mother, Gertrude.
Over the course of the play, Hamlet's mental health declines as his grief and anger overwhelm him.
Who Is Ophelia?
Ophelia is the daughter of Polonius, a counselor to Hamlet's uncle Claudius. She and Hamlet also happen to be in love.
King Claudius objects to the pair's romance as does her brother Laertes. Ophelia yearns to please the men in her family, but she also wants to be true to Hamlet.

While the character of Ophelia has been interpreted in many ways, she's generally known for her beauty and innocence as well as her lack of power in a patriarchal society. That lack of agency, plus personal pressures to please her father, brother and Hamlet torment her.
After Hamlet accidentally murders Ophelia's father and mocks her while ending their relationship, Ophelia's mental health unravels and she drowns herself and dies.
Her death isn't directly depicted in the text. Rather, it's announced by Queen Gertrude. Gertrude tells Laertes that Ophelia fell into a "weeping brook."

"But long it could not be/ Till that her garments, heavy with their drink/ Pulled the poor wretch from her melodious lay/ To muddy death," Gertrude says in Act 4, Scene 7. (Of note, in Swift's last big interview, appearing on "New Heights," fans clocked several mentions of the number 47. Later in the episode, she confirmed, “I love numerology.")
How Has Ophelia Been Depicted in Art and Pop Culture?

Ophelia has appeared again and again in pop culture and the arts. John Everett Millais’ 1852 painting, “Ophelia," depicts the character floating in water in a gauzy dress surrounded by lush greenery and flowers. With her eyes open, she looks dazed, and the image is meant to depict her singing before she drowns. Aussie pop star Kylie Minogue re-created that pose for her 1995 duet with Nick Cave, “Where the Wild Roses Grow.”
She's inspired countless more songs, perhaps most famously Bob Dylan's 1965 song "Desolation Row."

Dylan sings, "Now Ophelia, she’s ’neath the window/ For her I feel so afraid/ On her twenty-second birthday/ She already is an old maid," and later addressed the lack of power that is the character's undoing, singing, "Her sin is her lifelessness."
The Lumineers also namecheck the character in the 2016 song “Ophelia,” while members of the feminist punk band Ophelia Rising pay tribute to her with their name.

Most recently, Ophelia was the subject of a 2018 film "Ophelia" starring Daisy Ridley. The historical drama, which was based on the novel by Lisa Klein, depicts the tragedy of Hamlet from Ophelia's perspective.

title: Bad Bunny Gets a Little Too Comfortable at 'SNL' in Season Premiere Promo
summary: Bad Bunny makes himself at home in a new ‘SNL’ teaser as he gears up to host the Season 51 premiere with Doja Cat as musical guest.
story: Bad Bunny is making himself at home in his new “Saturday Night Live” promo.
The superstar will be hosting the Season 51 “SNL” premiere on Oct. 4, and he’s feeling a bit too comfortable, as seen in the first teaser.

The clip begins with “SNL” cast member Sarah Sherman asking Marcello Hernandez if he thinks Bad Bunny is “getting comfortable” with the cast since he’s made a number of appearances on the sketch show.
“Yeah, for sure,” replied Hernandez, adding, “I just, I can’t tell if he’s, like, too comfortable.”
The “Tití Me Preguntó” singer is then seen brushing his teeth and asking cast member Jane Wickline if it’s OK that he’s using her toothbrush.
In another scene, Ben Marshall walks by when Bad Bunny yells, “What’s up, slut?”
“Did you say, ‘slut’?” Marshall asks, before the singer quips that he loves the way they joke.
“You don’t know me that well,” Marshall adds as he walks away and Bad Bunny asks if he wants to grab coffee.
Newcomer Veronika Slowikowska is also seen in the promo, sharing how it’s her first day after the Puerto Rican star asks if “his friend, his baby (and) his dog” can stay at her place.
“Be careful. He bite,” Bad Bunny says, with Slowikowska replying, “The dog?”
“All of them,” the artist says.
The antics continue as he jokes with other cast members.
Bad Bunny has appeared on "SNL" multiple times as a musical guest, special guest and host. He is known for sketches like "Protective Mother" with Pedro Pascal and “Convent Meeting” with Mick Jagger.
His hosting duties come the same week he was announced as the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show performer.
The “SNL” Season 51 premiere with Bad Bunny hosting and musical guest Doja Cat airs Saturday at 11:30 p.m. ET/8:30 p.m. PT on NBC. The episode streams live on Peacock.

title: What Time Is 'Abbott Elementary' On? How to Watch Season 5
summary: What time is 'Abbott Elementary' on tonight? How to Watch Season 5, including what channel it's on and when it's streaming.
story: The Emmy-winning comedy "Abbott Elementary" is back in session this fall, with Season 5 set to premiere on Wednesday, Oct. 1.

The series, created by and starring Quinta Brunson, continues to follow the dedicated, and often chaotic, teachers at a Philadelphia public school. This year promises fresh faces, new challenges and plenty of the heartfelt humor fans have come to love.
Here's how to tune in.
When Is Season 5 of 'Abbott Elementary' On?
"Abbott Elementary" premieres on Wednesday, Oct. 1 at 8:30 p.m. ET/PT and 7:30 p.m. CT.
New episodes air Wednesdays at the same time.
How to watch 'Abbott Elementary'
"Abbott Elementary" airs live on ABC.
New episodes will be available to stream the next day on Hulu. Previous seasons are also available on Hulu.
'Abbott Elementary' episode release schedule
There are 22 episodes this season of "Abbott Elementary." ABC has already teased the first three episodes of the new season:

“Team Building,” out Oct. 1: "The teachers prepare for the upcoming school year with new faces and big changes on the horizon."“Cheating,” out Oct. 8:"Melissa tries to outsmart her students; Tariq causes chaos in Janine’s class; and a new guidance counselor joins the school."“Ballgame,” out Oct. 15: "The Abbott crew heads to the ballpark for Teachers’ Appreciation Night at the Philadelphia Phillies game."
“Team Building,” out Oct. 1: "The teachers prepare for the upcoming school year with new faces and big changes on the horizon."
“Cheating,” out Oct. 8:"Melissa tries to outsmart her students; Tariq causes chaos in Janine’s class; and a new guidance counselor joins the school."
“Ballgame,” out Oct. 15: "The Abbott crew heads to the ballpark for Teachers’ Appreciation Night at the Philadelphia Phillies game."

title: EXCLUSIVE: 'Scrubs' Star John C. McGinley Is a Fighter. His Son with Down Syndrome Is His Favorite Cause
summary: Actor John McGinley, Dr. Perry Cox on “Scrubs,”  describes life with his three kids: his oldest son Max, who has Down syndrome, and his teenage daughters.
story: As Dr. Perry Cox on “Scrubs,” John McGinley exhibited a hard-to-match intensity. In real life, that intensity comes out in his fierce devotion to his three kids, the oldest of whom was born with Down syndrome.
"It was like getting hit with a cosmic hammer," McGinley says of son Max's diagnosis at birth, on a video call with TODAY.com.

"Max was going to be a girl. Everything was all squared away. He showed up, and his 21st chromosome had tripled, he had heart issues and sleep apnea and some digestive tract problems, and I just shut down."

The year after Max’s birth was a roller coaster for McGinley and his ex-wife, Lauren Lambert. Adjusting to their new reality and keeping an eye on the heart condition Max was born with (which ultimately resolved itself) took some time, so McGinley stepped back from acting to focus on his family.

"It was time to circle the wagons and everything else had to wait," he says. "Since then, he has has grown into this lovely, lovely, stubborn, very opinionated young man who absolutely loves his sisters."
Raising Three Kids
Eventually, McGinley married his current wife, Nichole McGinley. In addition to Max, now 28, the couple raised their daughters Billie Grace, 17, and Kate, 15.
The girls are "so, so profoundly verbal, and that’s Maxie's biggest challenge," McGinley shares. In fact, that Kate plans to graduate high school two years early.
"It was a real focus to empower both of them, you know. Not put a wet blanket on Kate and Billy Grace being verbal, but still trying to empower Max to create as much language as he can," he says.
Balancing the very different needs of all three children can require a good deal of finesse, but the actor hasn't noticed any conflict between the three.

"I never wanted Max to be a burden to his two sisters. I wanted them to be the instigators or the initiators of activities done with their brother," McGinley explains. "They've treated Max as the biggest gift in the history of the planet, and it's shaped the way they see the world."
He emphasizes that “the way the girls treat their brother and have integrated Max into their lives, it’s the stuff of a parent’s dreams.”
Swinging For the Fences
Like many of the characters McGinley plays, he tends to think big.
His son loves swings, so McGinley made him some really big swings.
"You know that juice you're looking for when you're on the top arc of a swing? Max, he craves it," says McGinley, who refers to that "juice" as "vestibular stimulation."

When Max outgrew the playground swings, McGinley built something taller. He had giant swings constructed out of 25-foot telephone poles. McGinley says with a laugh, "They're ridiculous but they've yielded dividends."

In addition to swinging, Max loves to strum. He plays rhythm guitar for a band called Spec Labs. The band's name is derived from the fact that all of its musicians are on the spectrum in some capacity.
"Watching that evolution has been incredible because he used to play with his back to the audience, but eventually he turned around and played in front of the audience," McGinley says.
McGinley's Advocacy

McGinley cheers for his son in private but also advocates for him on a larger stage. He has been a staunch advocate for the GLOBAL Down Syndrome Foundation for years, primarily due to its focus on research and lobbying to ensure that every person with Down syndrome has an equitable chance at a satisfying life.

“This is going to sound a little crass, but I don’t want to be with a pamphlet-driven group,” McGinley says with Dr. Cox intensity. He wanted to support an organization that will create real, lasting change, and he believes GLOBAL will do just that.

As part of October's Down Syndrome Awareness Month, McGinley will take part in GLOBAL's "Be Beautiful, Be Yourself" fashion show, which is the largest fundraiser for Down syndrome in the world. He'll be one of the celebrity escorts helping models with Down syndrome rock the runway.
The Return of Dr. Cox
He will also be heading to Vancouver to film the "Scrubs" reboot, along with Zach Braff, Donald Faison and Sarah Chalke.

"I know we're shooting in Vancouver, and that's all I know, because I haven't seen a word of text," McGinley jokes while holding up his travel paperwork. "But it doesn't matter, Billy Lawrence is doing it. It's going to be great!"
In fact, McGinley asked series creator Lawrence to add a storyline with a special needs patient. And in Season 8, he did.
"It was great to put someone, a young adult born with Down syndrome on the show. He crushed it, and he crushed Dr. Cox and it was a great episode," McGinley recalls.

title: Molly Ringwald and Daughter Mathilda Make Rare Public Appearance Together
summary: Molly Ringwald's 21-year-old daughter, Mathilda Gianopoulos, made a rare red carpet appearance with her mom at the New York premiere of "Monster: The Ed Gein Story."
story: Molly Ringwald's 21-year-old daughter, Mathilda Gianopoulos, walked the red carpet with her at the New York City premiere of "Monster: The Ed Gein Story."

The duo stepped out together on Sept. 30 in two gorgeous outfits. Ringwald donned a white satin shirt, pleated pleather skirt and a pair of gold heels. As for Gianopoulos, she wore a beautiful white satin dress and a pair of pink ballet slippers.
Ringwald, who appeared in "Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story" as Shari Dahmer in 2022, was seen posing alongside her kid side by side on the red carpet.

Ringwald also shared pictures of their rare outing on social media. On Instagram, she shared two snaps of Gianopoulos posing in her outfit and another of her daughter sitting across from her at a table.
She captioned the pics, "My date and my ♥️#daughter," adding the hashtags #firstborn and #bettedaviseyes.
Ringwald shares Gianopoulos and her 16-year-old twins, Roman and Adele, with her husband, Panio Gianopoulos.

Like Ringwald, Gianopoulos has also taken an interest in acting. In 2024, she appeared in director Michael Showalter's film "The Idea of You." During a 2023 interview with People, Ringwald told the outlet how she feels about her daughter becoming an actor.
She said it's "something that we thought a lot about. She learned how to do it before but it’s a hard job and I think she knows what she’s in for.”
When asked how her mom prepared her for the role, Gianopoulos told the outlet that Ringwald gave her tips about "everything" she needed to know.
“Be prepared to wait and be nice, which you should always be anyways," she said of what her mother told her.
Ringwald added, “Remember people’s names."

Ringwald, who's known for films like "The Breakfast Club" and "Sixteen Candles," once told Andy Cohen that she fears watching her older movies with her kids because of the controversial elements in the films.

“My 12-year-old daughter Adele is the most woke individual that you’ve ever met, and I just don’t know how I’m going to go through that, you know, watching it with her and (her) saying, ‘How could you do that? How could you be part of something that—'" she said on SiriusXM's Radio Andy in 2021.

title: Selena Gomez's Engagement and Wedding Rings Analyzed by Jewelry Pros
summary: What are the details behind Selena Gomez's engagement ring? How big is it? How much did it cost? Find out all the details here.
story: Selena Gomez is now a married woman, and has the diamonds to show it.
On Saturday, Sept. 27, the “Only Murders in the Building” actor married longtime friend-turned-partner Benny Blanco, with both showing off moments from the California nuptials on social media.
Among a series of photos from the big day, Blanco shared a close-up shot of his hand under Gomez’s, giving a detailed image of her engagement ring, their wedding bands and his own diamond jewelry.
After Blanco proposed to Gomez in December 2024, the actor had the internet swooning over her engagement ring, which she called the “diamond I’ve always dreamed of” in a later interview.
Based on Blanco’s photo, she paired the engagement ring with diamond wedding band. Here’s what we know about Gomez’s engagement ring.
What does Selena Gomez’s engagement ring look like?
Gomez first showed off her engagement ring, which has a marquise-cut center stone and an infinity band, in December 2024.
Jeweler Simone Kendle, CEO of Wove, tells TODAY.com the ring is "diamond-forward" because of the "slightly thicker" band set with round diamonds.
"It’s a bold departure from the daintier bands we often see. It’s a statement of strength and radiance all at once," Kendle says.
Speaking to Interview Magazine, Gomez and Blanco said the ring initially had more bling — until Gomez changed her mind.
“It used to have huge baguettes on the side and then she was like, ‘I don’t want something that big,’” he said.
Gomez added, “I just think it’s too much.”
Those extra gemstones aren’t going to waste, however. In that interview, Blanco said they’ll use the extra baguettes to make earrings, adding Gomez “basically has three wedding rings.”
How many carats is Selena Gomez's wedding ring?
While Gomez has never confirmed the size of her engagement ring, jewelers have estimates.
Gemstone wholesaler Julia Hackman Chafé estimated the center stone is four carats with .25 carat stones lining the band.
Kendle, CEO of the jewelery brand Wove, estimated the ring is between three and four carats.
How much does Selena Gomez's wedding ring cost?
Gomez and Blanco have never confirmed the price, either, but Kendle placed the ring in the "$200,000 to $300,000 range," once the center stone is paired with the setting.
Scott Grimes, Designer of Christian James Jewelry, estimated the ring cost between $200,000 and $350,000.
The meaning behind the marquise diamond
The ring’s center stone seemed to nod to her 2015 collab with A$AP Rocky, “Good for You.’
In the same conversation with Interview Magazine, Gomez explained the marquise diamond was inspired by her previous music, as fans speculated.
“Ever since the ‘Good for You’ days — that was, gosh, so many years ago — that’s the diamond I’ve always dreamed of,” she said, showing off her ring.
In the song, Gomez, sings, “I’m in my marquise diamonds /I’m a marquise diamond /Could even make that Tiffany jealous.”

Referencing the song post-engagement, Blanco shared a social media video clinking champagne glasses with Gomez set to “Good for You,” specifically highlighting the line she sings about “marquise diamonds.”

title: Cillian Murphy Explains His Disinterested Expression — and Why It Serves Him as an Actor
summary: Cillian Murphy weighed in on why he thinks it's important for actors to be known for their work and not necessarily their personality
story: Cillian Murphy weighed in on why he thinks it's important for actors to be known for their work and not necessarily their personality.
In a preview clip for the Oct. 5 "Sunday Sitdown With Willie Geist," the Academy Award-winning actor spoke with Sunday TODAY anchor about why he doesn't seem too interested in becoming a celebrity.

"One of the things I admire about you, Cillian, is your complete disinterest in being a celebrity or a movie star," Willie said while laughing. "And that you’re an actor and you wanna be known for your work, and you’ve pulled that off."
Willie then asked Murphy why it was important for people not to know too much about him personally.

"I’ve always felt that if you wanna try and inhabit somebody convincingly that it seems sensible that there wouldn’t be too much — that people wouldn’t have an impression of you as an individual that would in some way inhibit your ability to do that," Murphy said.

"That’s kind of what I’ve always felt," he continued. "I like the transformative nature of acting. So if you can kinda keep that as background, then I think it allows you more freedom as a performer, you know?"

Murphy made a name for himself in roles like Christopher Nolan's  "Batman Begins" and "Inception," and the popular series "Peaky Blinders." When he landed the role of J. Robert Oppenheimer in Nolan's epic film, "Oppenheimer," he not took home an Oscar, but also became more of a household name.
The three-hour film won seven Oscars, including the Academy Award for best picture and Murphy's Oscar for best actor in a leading role.

Since the release of "Oppenheimer," Murphy has gone on to star in the Zombie movie, "28 Days Later," and "Small Things Like These," a film adaptation of Irish author Claire Keegan's book of the same name.

That film follows an Irish father in the 1980s as he discovers abuse occurring at a local convent's Magdalene Laundry. At laundries across the country, "fallen women" were forced into unpaid labor until the last laundry closed in 1996, according to the BBC.
Murphy described learning of the scandal as a "collective trauma for people of a certain age" at a 2024 press conference, according to the Guardian.

“I think the irony of the book is that it’s a Christian man trying to act Christian in a dysfunctional Christian society. And it asks a lot of questions about publicity and silence and shame, all of those things,” Murphy said. “But I really don’t think the duty of art is to answer those questions, it’s to talk to them. And maybe it’s easier to absorb than an academic report, or a political report.”
Murphy's newest role is in Netflix's "Steve," in which he portrays the titular role of a headteacher at a school for boys with societal and behavioral issues. "Steve" is set to premiere on Oct. 3.

title: 'Love Is Blind' Star Blake Anderson Explains Why He Abruptly Left the Show: EXCLUSIVE
summary: Blake Anderson explains why he left the Love Is Blind Season 9 despite having connections with multiple women.
story: “Love Is Blind” Season 9 is here and already viewers have seen an unprecedented amount of contestants quit the show compared to past seasons.
The ninth season of the hit Netflix reality dating show arrived on Oct. 1 with six episodes that introduced fans to 32 Denver singles hoping to add to the dating experiment’s success rate.
But while watching the love stories develop, fans suddenly learned that a whopping four contestants had exited the show, all of whom were heavily featured up until that point.

One of those contestants was Blake Anderson, a 34-year-old accountant who formed strong connections with Anna Yuan and Megan Walerius. However, in the first unexpected departure of the season, a message appeared in Episode 3 explaining that Yuan chose to leave the show. Anderson seemed stunned when a producer informs him about Yuan’s abrupt exit.
Later in the same episode, titled “Ghost Town,” Anderson was supposed to meet Walerius in the pods for a date. But he never showed. Another message updated viewers that he quit the show, as well.
In an interview with TODAY.com, Anderson revealed why he dropped out of the experiment and also shared if he has any regrets.
Anderson says that although his departure seemed hasty, he actually had doubts throughout the pod process. The accountant explains that the show’s timeline didn’t match his feelings.
“I think going into the experiment, everyone is keenly aware of the condensed timeline, and I certainly was as well,” he says. “But you go in optimistic.”
He shares that the first day of the pods stage is a “speed dating type of day” where all the contestants have lighthearted, fun dates with each other.
